title: Production publish readiness for CryptoLaunch Sentinel

requirements.text: Replace the current mock Discover feed data source with a backend-mediated projects fetch suitable for publishing (no mock project generation in the published app).
acceptanceCriteria: Discover page no longer relies on frontend/src/features/discover/providers/providers.ts mock generator for its primary data path.
Frontend requests new-project discovery data via the backend actor (React Query or existing actor hooks) instead of returning hardcoded demo projects.
If real provider integration is not configured/available, the UI shows a clear non-technical message that live data is unavailable and does not silently substitute mock projects.

requirements.text: Implement publish-time configuration for external data provider secrets in the backend and ensure secrets are never embedded in the frontend bundle.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes admin-only methods to set/update required API keys/secrets for providers that need them (Alchemy, Moralis, QuickNode, Bitquery, CoinMarketCap).
Backend stores secrets in canister state and never returns secrets to the frontend.
All secret-required HTTP calls are executed by the backend (using existing HTTP outcall capabilities) and return only the needed, sanitized response data to the frontend.

requirements.text: Make the Settings > Data Providers panel reflect real runtime/provider readiness instead of static placeholder statuses, so the published app accurately reports what is live.
acceptanceCriteria: Provider status values shown in the UI are fetched from the backend at runtime (not hardcoded constants).
The panel clearly differentiates: active (working), needs configuration (missing keys), and unavailable/error states.
User-facing text is in English and does not mention internal implementation details (e.g., no references to file names or mock generators).

requirements.text: Remove email fields and any email-related UI/data handling from user profiles to align with the project’s no-email scope before publishing.
acceptanceCriteria: backend/main.mo UserProfile no longer includes an email field, and related save/get logic is updated accordingly.
Any frontend profile setup/edit UI does not request, display, or store an email value.
No user-facing UI suggests email verification, email login, or email notifications.

requirements.text: Finalize publish-facing app metadata for the public build (document title and basic meta description) so the published app is not a generic template.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html has an app-appropriate title and meta description for “CryptoLaunch Sentinel”.
No user-facing placeholder/template text remains in the main page metadata.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor with all logic in backend/main.mo; only add backend/migration.mo if a real stable-state upgrade requires it.
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
Do not embed third-party API keys/secrets in the frontend bundle; secrets must be configured and used via the backend.
nonGoals: Executing or automating an actual mainnet deployment/CI pipeline outside the codebase (e.g., GitHub Actions setup)
Adding new product features unrelated to publishing readiness (e.g., payments, social login, chat, email features)
